page.title: 11HISTORY (FROYLE/HOLYBOURNE)
page.content: Our area has had people living in it for over 50,000 years (a Mousterian axe was found near Yarnhams Farm, also {burnt flints}and a {round barrow.}) The remains of the road from Silchester to Chichester can be seen and the Roman road from Winchester to London must have cut across the area. In the Bronze Age a{bronze brooch}was lost near the Roman road site and found a few years ago. Remains of a Roman building were found near Yarnhams Farm and a Saxon drain was discovered near Rye Bridge. {Saintbury Hill} was probably { {'Freya's' Hill}in pagan times. Freya was the goddess of corn and Froyle was probably named after her.
